field.label: URL Pattern
field.help: The URL pattern to match.

field.label: Match Type
field.help: Choose how to match on "URL Pattern".

field.label: URL Rewriting
field.help: Choose URL rewriting rules.

field.label: Enable Security Rules
field.help: Enable WAF

field.label: Learning Mode
field.help: Enable learning mode means nothing is blocked but logged.

field.label: Violation Error Page
field.help: Select a custom error page to display instead of the default builtin error pages for security rule violations. Only the page content itself is used. Status code rewriting and redirection is not supported.

field.label: Block XSS Score
field.help: Block XSS with a score above the specified value using generic detection.

field.label: Block SQL Injection Score
field.help: Block SQL injection with a score above the specified value using generic detection.

field.label: Custom Security Policy
field.help: Select custom security policies.

field.label: Upstream Servers
field.help: Select an upstream to proxy to or connect via FastCGI if chosen.

field.label: Path Prefix
field.help: Define an optional path prefix for this location. It will be prepended to the path so http://www.example.com/index.php will be sent to http://www.example.com/app/index.php on your upstream if you choose "/app" as path prefix.

field.label: Cache: Directory
field.help: Choose a cache directory if you want to cache responses.

field.label: Cache: Use Stale
field.help: If you enable this option, a stale response will be sent when in cases the original server is unable to (for example if it is down).

field.label: Cache: Minimum Uses
field.help: Enter how often the resource must be hit before adding it to the cache.

field.label: Cache: Background Update
field.help: Return a stale response to the client and update the cache.

field.label: Cache: Lock Backend on Update
field.help: Only allow a single request to call the backend on the same URL at a single time.

field.label: Cache: Revalidate
field.help: Only request a new version, if the content has changed since the last cache update.

field.label: Cache: HTTP Verbs
field.help: Select the HTTP verbs to cache. GET and HEAD will be always cached.

field.label: Limit Requests
field.help: If you choose multiple limits, the strictest will be used.

field.label: File System Root
field.help: Enter the file system root from which the files are served.

field.label: Maximum Body Size
field.help: If the request is larger, it will be rejectet with error 413 (Request Entity Too Large). For example, you can enter 200m.

field.label: Body Buffer Size
field.help: If the request exceeds this size, it will be written to disk. Enter a number and a unit like 1m.

field.label: Index File
field.help: Enter a list of file extensions, which are served instead of a directory. It is common to use index.html or index.php here.

field.label: Automatic Index
field.help: Check this to serve a file list when a directory is requested. This is useful for serving multiple files with someone without a web application. It is recommended to use this option only with authentication.

field.label: Basic Authentication
field.help: Enter the realm for this directory and enable authentication.

field.label: Basic Credentials List
field.help: Select a credential list to use.

field.label: Enable Advanced ACLs
field.help: Send an authentication request to the OPNsense backend for advanced access control.

field.label: IP ACL
field.help: If you select an IP ACL, the client can only access this service if it fulfills this requirement.

field.label: Satisfy
field.help: All: All access restrictions must be fulfilled; Any: Any of the access restrictions must be fulfilled.

field.label: Force HTTPS
field.help: If the request scheme is not HTTPS, redirect to use HTTPS for this location.

field.label: Pass Request To Local PHP Interpreter / Threat Upstream As FastCGI
field.help: Only use this setting if you know what you are doing. If not, expect your machine to get compromised. Use this setting when you want to run a local PHP application or call an external upstream, if selected, via FastCGI. Example upstreams are PHP-FPM or Rails via FastCGI API.

field.label: (PHP) Router Script
field.help: If you set this setting, all requests are sent to this script instead of the request path (URL). Not using this setting on a remote instance can be dangerous.

field.label: Honeypot
field.help: If you enable the honeypot, all requests to this location will go to a special temporary log which will be used to block the IP. This is dangerous because you may accidentally block legitimate users or search engines. The result is available as a special alias in the firewall section. For example you can trigger on locations of Wordpress for phpMyAdmin if you are not using it.

field.label: WebSocket Support
field.help: If you enable the WebSocket Support option, nginx will pass the upgrade header to the backed server. Mutually exclusive with Keepalive support.

field.label: Upstream Keepalive Support
field.help: Adds the directives required for upstream keepalive to work (enables HTTP 1.1 and clears the Connection header). Mutually exclusive with WebSocket support. Keepalive parameters must be set in Upstream settings too.

field.label: Proxy Read Timeout
field.help: Enter a custom timout between data received from the client after which the connection is closed.

field.label: TLS SNI Forwarding
field.help: Check this box, if you want to passthrough the hostname you get from the downstream to the upstream connection. Can be overriden in the upstream's hostname configuration. Please note, that TLS server certificates are validated against this servername. If the server name passed by the client leads to different processing on the upstream server (i.e. different virtual host is choosen), this may cause security leaks.

field.label: Proxy Buffer Size (kB)
field.help: By default this is the size of one page (4 or 8 Kilobytes). It can be changed.

field.label: Proxy Buffers: Count
field.help: Count of buffers for a single connection.

field.label: Proxy Buffers: Size (kB)
field.help: Size of buffers of a single connection

field.label: Proxy Busy Buffers Size (kB)
field.help: When this buffer size is reached, nginx will send a part of the response to the client.

field.label: Proxy Send Timeout
field.help: Enter a custom timout between data it sent to the client after which the connection is closed.

field.label: Response Buffering
field.help: If you enable the Response Buffering option, nginx will buffer response from the backed server.

field.label: Request Buffering
field.help: If you enable the WebSocket option, nginx will pass the upgrade header to the backed server.

field.label: Maximum Temporary File Size
field.help: The maximum temporary file size limit. This does not apply to cached requests and responses.

field.label: Ignore Client Abort
field.help: If you enable this option, nginx will not terminate the connection to the backend server if the client connection is terminated.

field.label: Error Pages
field.help: Select custom error pages to display instead of the default builtin error pages. Selection will override error pages configured on HTTP server.
